page.title: 14CAT'S HILL AREA
page.content: {SQUARE 3911 This consists mainly of fields grazed by sheep or planted with wheat,the boundaries being hedges & ditches. The main lines of{TRANSPORT}are the A414 & the B180. An electricity supply cable spans the farm land.{HOUSING}occupies the Western part of the area. There are a number of 1921 houses with Cold Harbour Farm & an old people's home called Netherfield House. There is an {industrial development}called D.W. Lighting and greenhouses belonging to the Ministry of Agriculture. There is a small empty church, St.James', in the grounds of the large house known as Stanstead Bury which has large gardens and paddocks containing sheep. The land slopes upwards to Cat's Hill in the north, & drops at 1:10 in the southwest. Terbets Hill is the sloping area to the south.
